pt: {sc}caricature{/sc} {sc}burlesque{/sc} {sc}parody{/sc} {sc}travesty{/sc} mean a comic or grotesque imitation. {sc}caricature{/sc} implies ludicrous exaggeration of the characteristic features of a subject.
{sc}burlesque{/sc} implies mockery especially through giving a serious or lofty subject a frivolous treatment.

pt.t: a nightclub {it}burlesque{/it} of a trial in court

pt: {sc}parody{/sc} applies especially to treatment of a trivial or ludicrous subject in the exactly imitated style of a well-known author or work.

pt.t: a witty {it}parody{/it} of a popular novel

pt: {sc}travesty{/sc} implies that the subject remains unchanged but that the style is extravagant or absurd.

pt.t: this production is a {it}travesty{/it} of the opera
